### Executive Summary – SEO Audit for https://www.acmecorp.com (Depth 1)

| Priority | Issue | Impact | Recommended Action |
|----------|-------|--------|--------------------|
| **High** | **Meta description missing** | Search snippets lack a compelling description, reducing click‑through rates. | Add a concise meta description (150‑160 characters) that includes primary keywords. |
| **High** | **Title length is 71 characters** | Over‑long titles may be truncated in SERPs, diluting keyword signal. | Shorten the title to ≤60 characters while keeping brand and main keyword (e.g., "Acme Corp – Innovative Business Solutions"). |
| **High** | **Missing H1 heading** | H1 is a primary SEO signal and improves accessibility. | Replace the `<h2>` with an `<h1>` containing the main keyword, then keep other headings as sub‑levels. |
| **Medium** | **Image without alt attribute** | Affects accessibility and missed keyword opportunity. | Add descriptive `alt` text to the hero image, e.g., `alt="Acme Corp modern office façade"`. |
| **Medium** | **PageSpeed score 58** | Slow load times hurt rankings and user experience. | Optimize images, enable compression, leverage browser caching, and consider a CDN. |
| **Low** | **No structured data markup** | Missing rich‑snippet opportunities. | Implement JSON‑LD `Organization` schema and, if applicable, `BreadcrumbList` to aid SERP display. |

All other checks (mobile‑friendliness, canonical tag, etc.) passed.

**Next Steps**: Prioritize fixing the meta description, title, and H1 as they have the highest SEO value. After those are addressed, move on to image alt texts and performance optimizations. Feel free to ask for a full detailed report or for help implementing any of the recommendations.
